metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with one part shaded. Place a tick on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to show how much is shaded.

prompt.text: Place a tick to match the shaded amount.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look at how many parts are shaded on the bar.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare] The bar has three equal parts. [event:A_compare_shaded] One part is shaded, so we need the tick that shows one out of three parts.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the shaded tick on a number line to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match this. The bar shows one shaded part out of three equal parts. [event:A_arrow] We count from zero to the first tick - that's one-third. That's the tick that matches the shaded amount.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You matched the shaded part to one-third on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with some parts shaded. Place a tick on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to show how much is shaded.

prompt.text: Place a tick to match the shaded amount.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count how many parts are shaded in the bar.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's look at this more carefully. [event:A_compare][event:A_compare_shaded] The bar has 3 equal parts total, and 2 of them are shaded. Your tick should show two-thirds.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the two-thirds tick on the number line to show the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match the bar to the [vocab]number line[/vocab]. [event:A_arrow] The bar shows 2 out of 3 equal parts shaded, which is two-thirds. The tick goes at the two-thirds mark on the number line. That's how we connect the bar model to the number line.

on_correct.dialogue: Good. You placed the tick at two-thirds to match the shaded bar.

metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with one part shaded. Find where that same amount belongs on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] below.

prompt.text: Place a tick to match the shaded amount.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look at how many parts the bar has and find the matching [vocab]position[/vocab] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare] The bar is divided into 4 equal parts, and [event:A_compare_shaded] one part is shaded. Find the tick that shows one out of four equal spaces on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the shaded tick on the number line to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match these. The bar has 4 equal parts with 1 part shaded. That's one-fourth. On the [vocab]number line[/vocab], [event:A_arrow] we count one space from zero to find one-fourth. That's the first tick after zero.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You matched the shaded part to one-fourth on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with three out of four parts shaded. Place a tick on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to show where this [vocab]fraction[/vocab] belongs.

prompt.text: Place a tick mark to show the fraction.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count how many parts are shaded in the bar.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare] Look at the bar - it has four equal parts total. [event:A_compare_shaded] Three of those parts are shaded. Your tick should show three-fourths on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the 3/4 tick on the number line to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match the bar to the [vocab]number line[/vocab]. [event:A_arrow] The bar shows three out of four equal parts shaded, so we place the tick at the third mark - that's three-fourths. See how the shaded portion matches exactly where the tick goes?

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You placed the tick at three-fourths to match the shaded bar.

metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with one part shaded. Place a tick on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to show how much is shaded.

prompt.text: Place a tick mark to represent the shaded amount.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look at how many parts are shaded in the bar.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare] The bar shows six equal parts total, and [event:A_compare_shaded] only one part is shaded. Your tick should match that one shaded part.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the shaded tick on a number line to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how this works. The bar has six equal parts, and one part is shaded. That means we need to place the tick [event:A_arrow] at the first mark on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] - that's one-sixth. See how the tick lines up with the one shaded part?

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You matched the shaded part to one-sixth on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with five out of six parts shaded. Find where that amount belongs on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

prompt.text: Place a tick mark to represent the shaded amount.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count the shaded parts on the bar, then find that same [vocab]position[/vocab] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare] Look at how many parts are shaded on the bar. [event:A_compare_shaded] Five parts out of six are shaded, so we need to find the tick that shows five-sixths.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the shaded tick on the number line to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match the bar to the [vocab]number line[/vocab]. The bar has five out of six parts shaded. [event:A_arrow] We count five-sixths from zero on the number line, which brings us to this tick right here. That's how we match five-sixths on the bar to five-sixths on the number line.

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You matched five-sixths on the bar to five-sixths on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with some parts shaded. Place a tick on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to show how much is shaded.

prompt.text: Place a tick to match the shaded amount.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count how many parts are shaded on the bar.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's look at this more carefully. [event:A_compare][event:A_compare_shaded] The bar has 4 equal parts total, and 2 of them are shaded. Find that same spot on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the 2/4 tick on the number line to show the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me walk you through this. The bar shows 2 out of 4 equal parts shaded. [event:A_arrow] We place the tick at [fraction numerator=2 denominator=4]two fourths[/fraction] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] - that's 2 parts out of 4. See how the shaded amount matches the tick [vocab]position[/vocab]?

on_correct.dialogue: Good. You matched the shaded amount to the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can place ticks on a number line matching to a shaded rectangle bar.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with some parts shaded. Place a [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to show the same [vocab]fraction[/vocab].

prompt.text: Place a tick mark to match the shaded fraction.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count how many parts are shaded in the bar.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the top bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the top bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare][event:A_compare_shaded] Look at the bar - it's divided into 6 equal parts, and 3 of them are shaded. Your tick mark should show three-sixths on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the 3/6 tick on the number line to show the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match the bar to the [vocab]number line[/vocab]. [event:A_arrow] The bar has 3 out of 6 parts shaded, so we place the tick at three-sixths on the number line. See how the tick lines up with the same [vocab]fraction[/vocab] shown in the bar?

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You placed the tick at three-sixths to match the shaded bar.
